name: contagiously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a disease spreads contagiously, people catch it from direct contact with someone else who has it (= for example, by touching them, or touching something they have also touched) : The disease has clearly spread contagiously through the entire population.
in a way that causes many other people or things to be affected: The effects of the company's collapse spread contagiously though the financial system.
in a way that causes other people to feel the same way: He has a contagiously cheerful personality. Her colleagues described her as being contagiously enthusiastic.
More examplesFewer examplesI have never seen a project take off so contagiously as this one.He is a contagiously optimistic character who inspires hope in everyone who meets him.They make music that is contagiously likable and fresh.
